Headline: Riyadh - Live the Modern Life to its Fullest Description:

In the ever-growing and flourishing city of Riyadh, you will discover the birthplace of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, along with its historical treasures hidden in the old palaces that witnessed the founding of the kingdom. It is a destination for tourists from all over the globe who wish to discover a world of shopping, entertainment and business. The malls offer the most exciting shopping experience, and the sand dunes combined with the brightest stars in the sky present the most magical experience in nature. It is an environment full of a natural variety and unique characteristics that are intriguing for explorers. On the other side of the bustling city, you can enjoy a variety of experiences in luxurious restaurants that offer their special services, and their elaborate international dishes. Simultaneously, the local Riyadh restaurants will tempt you with their authentic flavors and blend of spices originating from Saudi culture. Everyone is happy in the city of Riyadh where the biggest cultural events are always celebrated. Endless entertainment destinations are always emerging, for the cityâ€™s visitors to have intriguing and renewing experiences.

Headline: Diriyah - A City that Embraces the History of Saudi Arabia Description:

In Diriyah, you will be introduced to a distinct dimension of entertainment, which is the heart of a historical city that was established in 1446 AD. It takes you back to the ancient history of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia through its old streets, heritage landmarks and unique natural components. It is strategically located on the banks of Wadi Hanifah, northwest of Riyadh, to be a world-class cultural suburb. It holds museums in its old buildings to give you a glimpse into the past. Diriyah has gained a historical and heritage status, and in 2010, At-Turaif District was registered as a UNESCO World Heritage site.

From the diverse nature to the stunning architecture, visitors go to Diriyah to spend a great time in its parks, where there are seasonal events, folk performances, markets and restaurants with an authentic traditional style.

Restaurants and cafes in Diriyah - Visit Saudi Official Website

Headline: Dammam - A pearl on the coast of the Arabian Gulf Description:

Dammam possesses the qualities of scarcity, originality and wealth, which made it the pearl of the Arabian Gulf. Its strategic location in the eastern region is of great importance to the economy of Saudi Arabia, as it includes the first oil well that produced promising commercial quantities that allowed Saudi Arabia to lead the scene of global oil markets to this day. The well was named "Al-Khair Well," aka Dammam Well No. 7.

The city combines renewed modern destinations and originality in its local markets adorned with exquisite traditional crafts, such as weaving, pottery and wicker making. On its beaches, you will also discover the pleasure of refreshing summer activities and interesting cruises.

Dammam residents are characterized by a friendly nature and cultural openness due to their city's location on the Gulf. Since 1986, King Fahd Causeway has been connecting Dammam and Bahrain and is a gateway for communication and cultural integration.

Headline: Al-Ahsa - The largest palm oasis in the world Description:

You will fall in love with Al-Ahsa from the first visit. You will find a warm welcome from the locals, with their distinctive accent and originality that shows in the mastery of exquisite products. Al-Ahsa people inherited handicrafts and live in a natural environment characterized by fertile land and varied industry. It has enjoyed an important commercial position since the year 960 AD, as it was a gateway to communication with the countries of the world and a meeting place for various civilizations through the port of Al-Uqair, which is the most important historical destination in the city. It also has many archaeological sites, including the Al-Ahsa Oasis, which is inscribed in the UNESCO World Cultural Heritage List.

When you visit Al-Ahsa, you will discover fascinating secrets. In its vast desert, there is the Ghawar field, the largest oil field in the world, and its farms contain millions of palm trees, as it is classified as the largest palm oasis in the world in the Guinness Book of Records. It is also famous for its springs, wells, and farms, whose date production exceeds one and a half million tons annually.

Headline: The Mountainous City and its Rural Nature Description:

Like any mountainous city, Taif is embedded in clouds. It offers a tranquil setting and pleasure characterized by magnificence and purity. Taif, the friend of the clouds, characterized by the cool weather, is located on the eastern slopes of the Sarawat Mountains and about 1,700 m above sea level. It increases in height as you head towards its southern rural areas, reaching a height of 2,400 m, where you find its rich farms and lively traditions.
Here we recommend the most amazing events that can be organized among its mountains and fields. In the guide, we include its most popular and beautiful areas.

Here we recommend the most amazing events that can be organized among its mountains and fields. In the guide, we include its most popular and beautiful areas.

Taif is famous for producing citrus fruits such as grapes, berries, pomegranates and figs.Â  It is also famous for scented roses, which are produced in more than 700 farms. In addition, the city is filled with historical monuments, markets, popular squares, unique gardens and cultural places. With a higher look towards its towering mountains, you see its luxurious cafes and hotels on the edges of the heights appearing like a historical city at night.
Taif top attractions - Visit Saudi Official Website

Headline: Tabuk - A mixture of tradition and modernity Description:

The sky of Tabuk Province resounds with traditional arts mixed with the melodies of the rababa and sung poems. Some of the province's archaeological sites date back 500 years BC and are filled with timeless historical stories. Tabuk was an ancient trading route due to its location in the northwestern part of the Arabian Peninsula, and its fertile land produces crops that compete in global markets, such as fruits, vegetables, wheat, and barley, in addition to millions of roses that color the city's farms. Its inhabitants are renowned for their local industries, such as upholstery, tents, boats, and swords. The Tabuk cuisine offers a rich cultural blend due to its proximity to the Levant. Its stunning geography offers diverse experiences, living on golden beaches, a barren desert, towering mountains, and springs that have been flowing for hundreds of years.

Headline: Jazan - Authentic cultural mix Description:

Jazan is characterized by a stunning geographic, environmental, and cultural diversity. As soon as you embark on a journey to explore this enchanting coastal region, which stretches for 200 kilometers along the Red Sea coast, you will discover exciting experiences, ranging from scuba diving to climbing Al Qahr and Fifa Mountains. The region is known for producing the finest tropical fruits, such as mangoes, bananas, papayas, and figs.

Jazan allows you to enjoy the breathtaking nature on Farasan Islands, which are registered in the UNESCO Man and the Biosphere Program. The region also includes historical monuments that date back to 8,000 BC, in addition to a number of promising industrial projects. Jazan has multiple dimensions of life, where modern life coexists with traditional villages that are rich in authentic traditions. The hospitable people of Jazan radiate a captivating simplicity, welcoming visitors with utmost warmth and kindness, while adhering to a mesmerizing traditional culture, reflected in their vibrant colors that appear in their clothing and architectural patterns. The locals adorn their heads with fragrant white jasmine flowers. Jazan's cuisine offers the most delicious local dishes in Saudi Arabia, where fresh ingredients are cooked skillfully using traditional tools to produce extremely appetizing meals.

Headline: Start discovering Abha with all your senses Description:

At an altitude of 2,200 m between the peaks of the Sarawat Mountains, Abha, is ideally located in southwestern region of Saudi Arabia. Its exceptional location allows you to embrace the clouds and wonder around its mountaintops. While consumed with astonishment and amusement, you will feel like time traveling hundreds of years back in time as you stumble upon castles and palaces built from the elements taken from their unspoiled environment.

Â 

Making your way through the fog, even in summertime, you will easily find its plains and cliffs and its rich diversity. You will get a chance to learn closely about the artistic community, and how, hundreds of years ago, women extracted the bright colors from trees and stones to redecorate the spaces and embellish their houses with, a type of abstract art, traditional Qatt Al Aseeri, which is now recognized as a global symbol that expresses man and place.

In Abha, you can enjoy listening to old tales, as you wander around ancient houses that date back to hundreds of years ago. These have been turned into museums by their owners and made available for the world to experience. During your tour, you can have a taste of the past by the diverse selection of traditional dishes offered by museum owners as a rich sensory experience to top your visit. Make sure to get souvenirs engraved with Al-Qatt Al-Aseeri art, which is listed by UNESCO in 2017 on its list of intangible cultural heritage, before you leave. This way, you will leave with Abha deeply engraved in your memory.

Headline: KAEC - A vibrant modern destination Description:

Located on the shores of the Red Sea and spanning an area of 181 million square meters, King Abdullah Economic City is one of the most important economic cities in the world. The city boasts a modern lifestyle, destinations that encourage tranquility and relaxation, and modern living details. It is one of the newest cities in Saudi Arabia, established in 2005 by King Abdullah bin Abdulaziz Al Saud and has become one of the most important entertainment destinations visited by millions of visitors. The city is covered with green spaces and features King Abdullah Port, the fastest-growing port in the world, as well as family-friendly activities such as luxurious resorts, locally styled accommodations, and water activities on stunning beaches. Additionally, the city's beautiful marine facade offers an exceptional experience that blends captivating natural components. The city also features thrilling adventures that take your breath away, such as scuba diving, rowing, and go-karting for enthusiasts.

Headline: Al-Baha Province - Home to farms and forests Description:

Al-Baha Province is filled with dense forests, mountains, and waterfalls, along with captivating valleys. The province also holds a rich history, evident in the engravings and drawings left on its mountains and valleys, as well as a heritage full of ancient traditions, reflected in its traditional dishes, historical villages, heritage museums, and popular markets that showcase the details of the past.

Its fertile lands produce several crops, including vegetables, grains, and seasonal fruits such as grapes, pomegranates, apples, peaches, and prickly pears.

The delicious taste of Al-Baha's honey reflects the quality and authenticity of local production. Visitors can taste and purchase honey as part of the experiences that the region offers. It is one of the most important honey-producing regions in Saudi Arabia, where its locals have been keeping bees for hundreds of years.

Headline: AlUla - A Glamorous Destination that Makes Your Eyes Sparkle Description:

AlUla, with its rich details, is a historical mine people seek from all over the world.Â  On its land cultures met, and many civilizations were built, especially at Hegra, the first Saudi site to enter the UNESCO World Heritage List.

In its historical landmarks, you will discover hidden stories, as its rocks are full of obscure symbols, exquisite inscriptions and texts leading back to the first century BC.Â  Its land still uncovers one secret after another leading us to new historical deductions every day.

Its inhabitants welcome you with smiles and joy, coming from the generosity of the Arab culture.Â  The restaurants here offer your tastebuds a special experience, surprising you with a combination of innovative dishes in front of amazing views.

Its unique terrain gives you the chance of living exceptional experiences such as rock climbing, hiking, and camping in the beautiful desert under a starry sky, in addition to seasonal events and musical and cultural activities combining a rich history with a modern taste.

Headline: Hail - A rich historical scene Description:

Hail, also known as the Key to the Desert and the Bride of the North, is renowned for its authentic generosity because Hatim Al-Tai, renowned across the Middle East and South Asia for his extreme generosity, resided there a long time ago. Hail is a region with a history that extends back to prehistoric times, rich in diverse terrains, from vast deserts to plains, valleys, and rocky areas, as well as a series of mountains, including Aja and Salma. Due to its important strategic location, it was a crossing point for pilgrims from the north of the Kingdom.

Hail is home to landmarks dating back to the Stone Age, as well as two UNESCO World Heritage Sites. The first site is Jabal Umm Sanman in Jubbah, located 100 kilometers northwest of Hail City. It contains over 5,000 rock art engravings and inscriptions dating back to the 7th millennium BC and is a tourist destination that attracts heritage, rock art, and archeology enthusiasts. The second site is the twin mountains of Rat and Al-Manjour, located about 320 kilometers south of Hail City, which contains historical and archeological landmarks from various eras.

Hail also caught the attention of European explorers in the past, and its historical landmarks served as titles for their writings. Its rock art engravings on its mountains have also served as a unique form of human art.Â

Hail has continued to thrive and grow, making it one of the leading cities in Saudi Arabia since it was annexed in 1921. Its history is filled with a mix of civilizations, and its desert offers fascinating experiences. It hosts the famous Hail Rally, one of the world's prominent car races, on its sand dunes.

Headline: Al Jouf - Farms, monuments and a promising future Description:

Al Jouf is home to olive trees and is known for the fertility of its land and the suitability of its climate for producing the finest crops, such as olives, dates, grains, fruits, and vegetables. The region has a rich history dating back millions of years. It contains historical sites from the Stone Age and even earlier, as well as palaces and ancient castles that preserve their old appearance, taking visitors on a journey through time. Al Jouf offers many options for outdoor entertainment, with stunning geological features such as fresh groundwater wells, mountains, deserts, and plains. The region is also one of the best sources of non-oil energy due to its flat land, which allows for the capture of solar energy. Al Jouf is adorned with seasonal festivals that provide glimpses into the rich identity of the area, as well as several tourist destinations, including green parks, activity-rich shopping centers, and modern and traditional restaurants offering delicious cuisine.

Headline: Makkah - The Site of Islamâ€™s Revelation and the Qiblah (Prayer Direction) of Muslims Description:

In the past, it was called Bakkah, Umm Al-Qura, and Al-Balad Al-Amin, and its mountains witnessed the first revelation.Â  Its visitors stand in amazement in front of the honorable Kaaba, the qiblah of Muslims from all over the world, in the middle of Masjid Al-Haram with its majestic view, surrounded by thousands of worshipers all the time. Makkah welcomes millions of Muslims who go to Hajj or Umrah.Â  It is the purest spot on Earth, and the holiest Islamic destination in the world, and it includes historical destinations that reveal immortal stories that left their mark in Islamic history.Â  It was also an important commercial station for mobile trade caravans between the north and south, and an area rich in literary forums, and seasonal markets that highlighted its cultural and commercial status. Makkah receives guests from all over the world but entry to the Haram area is for Muslims only.

Headline: Al Madinah: The First Islamic Capital Description:

Historically known as Yathrib, Al Madinah was established in the 6th century B.C. It is celebrated as the place where Muhammad established the Muslim community. Al Madinah is steeped in Islamic heritage, and it is home to the Quba Mosque (the first mosque built in Islam) as well as the Prophetâ€™s Mosque, which is considered to be the second-holiest mosque after Makkahâ€™s Grand Mosque.

Yathrib came to prominence centuries ago because of its location; it sits among various trade routes and has unique geographical features, including mountains, plains, oases, and gold, silver and copper mines. Al Madinah receives millions of Muslims from all around the world on their religious journeys each year, though both Muslims and non-Muslims are free to explore Al Madinahâ€™s many attractions. These include Jabal Uhud, Jabal Al Rayah, Archersâ€™ Hill and Jabal Thawr, all of which hold historical and religious importance, as well as Al Madinah Museum and the Dar Al Madinah Museum, where guests can explore the cityâ€™s roots.

Headline: Al-Qassim Province- The Source of Goods and Land of Poets Description:

A land that poets wrote about and that supplies over 74 countries with the finest dates.  Its goods include vegetables, grains, and dates, making it a special location for trade and agriculture. It produces over a million tons of crops annually and crowns its harvest season with Buraidah Date Festival.

Al-Qassim Province captivates the hearts of visitors with its cultural heritage, historical landmarks, and beautiful nature.  It is located within the Najd Highland which includes Riyadh, Al-Qassim, and Hail.  Wadi al-Rummah crosses Al-Qassim from East to West and is the longest valley in the Arabian Peninsula.  It also includes many places that are mentioned by poets, such as Uyun AlJiwa which witnessed the love story of one of the most important Arab poets, Antarah ibn Shaddad, and Jabal Rama wa Ramtan in Al Badayea City which were mentioned by the poet Zuhayr ibn Abi Sulma.  When passing through these areas, you will sense their ancient history and magical stories amidst the tall palm trees.

Headline: Al Jubail -One of the largest industrial cities in the world Description:

On the shores of the Arabian Gulf in the Eastern Province of Saudi Arabia, Al Jubail shines with its stunning beaches, vast green parks, modern commercial complexes, and luxurious restaurants offering delicious dishes with colourful sea views. Al Jubail is one of the world's largest industrial cities, with several industrial complexes for petrochemical, primary, and secondary industries owned by the Saudi company SABIC. The history of this fascinating coastal city dates back to 1910. It also reveals historical sites and archaeological landmarks and includes Al Jubail Port, one of the most famous ports in Saudi Arabia, known since ancient times as one of the most important centres for pearl extraction. Al Jubail is also one of the most important recreational destinations, with its elegant streets adorned with shrubs, and the Gulf waters revealing exciting activities such as swimming, diving, and fishing. Its green gardens and beautiful parks encourage living moments of fun to create the most beautiful memories.

Headline: Najran- Reservoirs of nature and the magic of history Description:

On the southern banks of the largest desert in the Kingdom lies the region of Najran, land of culture, heritage, ancient civilizations, and geographic diversity. Najran takes you on a journey through history, encompassing the Hima Cultural Area, registered on the UNESCO World Heritage List, which contains inscriptions and artifacts left by humans throughout the ages on one of the oldest caravan routes in Najran. The region then leads you to explore the history in its desert inscriptions and artifacts, which offer glimpses into its rich past and the details of human life over the ages.

Between oases, mountains, and deserts, Najran captivates you with its fertile soil, fresh water, and moderate climate for most of the year. All these factors have enabled the region to provide the Kingdom with the bounty of its agricultural land, especially citrus fruits that have thrived since 1982. Its abundant palm trees produce luxurious dates, including the Baiadh and Al-Muwakal varieties. The Najran mountains also contain vast mineral wealth, including the famous granite, which is distinguished by its vibrant colors and high quality. It is exported to more than 28 countries around the world and has been used in parts of the expansion of the Two Holy Mosques in Makkah and Madinah, as well as on the Champs-Ã‰lysÃ©es in Paris.

Title: International Falcons & Hunting Exhibition
Event Description: An international exhibition that serves as a platform bringing together enthusiasts of falcons, hunting, weapons, and cars for desert trips, along with their equipment, to highlight the historical heritage of the kingdom in a cultural and entertainment carnival.

Title: The Saudi Cup 2023
Event Description: The fourth version of the most valuable horserace in the world, where many horse owners, Jockeys and horses will participate from different continents all around the world in this mega event. With total prize money of $20 million, paid out all the way down to tenth place, The Saudi Cup is the worldâ€™s most valuable race and is offered on a weekend card now worth $35.35 million, following the introduction of the Tuwaiq Cup, a contest over 1800m on the dirt held on the Friday of Saudi Cup weekend and worth $500,000. There will be family activities, F&B offerings and cultural activations.

Title: WWE - NIGHT OF CHAMPIONS
Event Description: WWE presents Night Of Champions at the Jeddah Superdome, the worldâ€™s largest pillarless Superdome, on Saturday, May 27, 2023. Featuring WWEâ€™s biggest Superstars, the event will for the first time see one Superstar crowned the new World Heavy Weight Champion.

Title: Dakar in Saudi
Event Description: From December 31st, there will be a new itinerary for the fourth edition of the Dakar in Saudi Arabia, 2022, to January 15, 2023, including the first round of the FIA-FIM World Rally-Raid Championship. The route will take the pilots from the beaches of the Red Sea to the sands of the Arabian Gulf in Dammam. This crossing of the country will be, in fact, a complete tour as the 14 stages will first lead the Dakar to the North-Western mountain regions before heading to the deep South-East for a three-day journey through the ocean of dunes in the Empty Quarter.

Title: Boulevard Riyadh City
Event Description: Boulevard Riyadh City is one of the biggest zones in the season. Triple in size this year, each of the sub-areas features its own set of activities, restaurants, events, and outlets that are catered to all visitors.

Title: Qariat Zaman 
Event Description: Qaryat Zaman takes us back to the old days of the 80s and 90s. Many traditional Games, experiences and authenitic snacks. A place that takes us back to our happy memories.

Title: Masameer | V2
Event Description: The Masameer trio returns again with a new exciting adventure after being kidnapped by aliens fleeing to the planet Ezekiel, looking for a way out to return to Riyadh.

Title: Ana Arabia
Event Description: Ana Arabia in its fourth edition, an exhibition where Excellence Meets Passion, Crafting a Historical Legacy in the World of Fashion, and Unveiling a Transformational Journey Beyond Boundaries, Igniting Your Senses and Redefining Luxury.

Title: Al Majlis
Event Description: Almajlis," an event on Saudi Founding Day, aims to educate visitors about the heritage and cultural depth of the First Saudi State through lectures, panel sessions, and workshops. In addition to activities such as an artist from my country, melodies from my country, calligraphy arts, and our history as seen through our eyes.

Title: Founding Day Parade
Event Description: Let's explore the values of the founding day with a vast horses parade that tells us a story of authenticity, connectivity, development, and a narration of bravery, perfection, and generosity that the soldiers of our kingdom and our fellow citizens tell us with a parade of horses and giant artistic figures.

Title: Blippi
Event Description: The little adventurers with Blippi live a unique adventure through which they encounter different worlds, to return to the age of dinosaurs, dive to the bottom of the ocean and then fly into space, all through one experience in the world of Blippi.

Title: The Farm
Event Description: Farmer William, lives inside his mysterious farm, isolated from people, while carrying out many experiments until he developed a poison from the plant extracts capable of destroying humanity.

Title: Le Comptoir De Nicole
Event Description: The renowned French bistro from the CÃ´te dâ€™Azur is synonymous with authenticity and friendliness. Le Comptoir de Nicole is an ode to Mediterranean cuisine, with only the freshest, hand-picked produce making it to the table and into its most prized recipes.

Title: Le Vesuvio
Event Description: Named after the famous volcano in Naples, Le Vesuvio is an Italian dining experience centering itself around authentic and high-quality ingredients that work to celebrate Northern Italian cooking techniques and traditions.

Title: City Walk
Event Description: A recreational zone for the whole family, various activities some of which are for the first time in Jeddah and the whole world, its shops and restaurants are diverse that satisfy all tastes.

Title: Schiller Bikes Experience
Event Description: Schiller water bikes are extraordinary machines designed to propel you across the water. It is the ultimate water experience.

Title: Jeddah Waves
Event Description: The most entertaining water activities all in one spot: The adrenaline-infusing Jeddah Waves is here. -Food and beverages are not allowed from outside the zone.

Title: Seabob Experience
Event Description: Seabob experience is an exceptional adventure where you can play on the waves and under the water for 15 minutes, as well as have access to the swimming and sunbathing area and practice football and table tennis on the beach.

Title: Paddle Boarding Experience
Event Description: Stand up paddle boarding (SUP) offers a fun way to play on the water, with the added benefit of a full-body workout. And, since you stand at full height on your board, it gives you a unique vantage point for viewing whatâ€™s down under the water and out on the horizon.

Title: Jet Ski Ticket
Event Description: Whether you enjoy spending time with friends or feeling your heartbeat through your chest riding on a jet ski gives you the ultimate experience.

Title: Kayaks Experience
Event Description: It is a light activity that you can have in the sea to enjoy the weather and soak up the sun.

Title: Powr Villa
Event Description: Want to meet, engage and have fun with your gaming heroes? Powr Villa will give you that chance and more! you'll be getting hands-on experience with a variety of exclusive, globally renowned game titles such as Tekken 8 and Resident Evil, making it truly a gamers' paradise!

Title: Japamura 2
Event Description: Anime, ninjas, sushi, and matcha - Japamura is back! Get ready for a bigger and better Japamura and choose from a variety of classes, food, and experiences for all ages. Discover the Hidden Ninja Dojo, join origami classes, wear a Japanese yukata and take kawaii pictures exclusively at Japamura, GAMERS8!

Title: Aramco Sim Racing
Event Description: If you love racing, then this is the perfect venue for you. Zoom into the season and get the chance to race on our state-of-the-art simulators and partake in our weekly racing tournaments.

Title: Azimuth 2023
Event Description: Step into a thrilling world where music, art, food, and culture collide to create a festival experience unlike any other. Over two electrifying days, the mythical canyons of AlUla will blaze with performances from top-tier artists from our region and beyond. This is the beating heart of the party â€” all that's missing is you.

Title: SOUNDSTORM 2023: Music Festival In Riyadh
Event Description: Join us on the dancefloor once more at Soundstorm â€˜23. You read that right - the forecast says the storm is back again on Dec. 14,15 and 16, 2023! Another weekend of lights, beats and the BIGGEST stars - all in Riyadh.

Title: Saudi Games

Title: Terhal
Event Description: Terhal is the biggest Saudi spectacle done at a monumentally international level in celebration of the diverse cultures of the Kingdom. It is the tale of young Saad striving to shape the future by rediscovering our cultural and natural heritage in the age of technology. Inspired by the stunningly epic landscapes of Saudi Arabia, the show incorporates the values and traditions of the Saudi people, including their customs, hospitality, clothing, contemporary and folklore dances, and much more. Using natural elements and the latest theatrical technologies, Terhal brings together young Saudi talents and renowned global artists in a magnetic performance that will stir emotions and position the Kingdom among the leading countries in the world in music and performing arts.

Title: The Art Library Exhibitions
Event Description: Misk Art Institute is committed to providing content and context for the Arab art sector through The Art Library: Discovering Arab Artists. This initiative is dedicated to publishing a series of books contextualizing the artistic methods and journeys of prominent Arab artists. The publications, available in Arabic and English, focus on documenting and displaying selected artworks to demonstrate the significant roles these artists have played in shaping the Arab world's modern and contemporary art scenes. Volumes nine and ten of The Art Library highlight Saudi artist Manal AlDowayan and Emirati artist Hassan Sharif. A selection of the artistâ€™s seminal works is presented alongside written contributions from local and international art critics and curators. The book on Manal AlDowayan is an intimate exploration of her participatory approach to art, which addresses the crucial topic of gender-specific, socio-political obstacles and narratives in Saudi Arabia. Hassan Sharif's book examines the concept of weaving throughout his oeuvre, which became as much a conceptual approach as it was a performative action.

Title: Fenaaphone Exhibion
Event Description: Unpacking a treasure trove of collected items from the 1950s to the modern day, through FenaaPhone, we examine the emergence of a Saudi popular music scene and investigate some of the reasons for its lasting success. We present a curated dialogue in five sections by exploring the unique and expanding ephemera acquired by Saudi artist Dr. Saad Al Howede over the past decade. Folk to Formal explores the earliest music and its structural shifts; Tuning from Within expands on the beginnings of the local music industry; We Are Now Live walks us through a maturing regional and global music scene; Make it Pop! showcases the influence of print and its critical coverage of events; and finally, Voices of the Current considers the scene in contemporary times. With FenaaPhone, we invite viewers to reflect on Saudi popular music through the ages and to consider its importance today.

Among them and who is behind everything that happens to them?

Title: 17-Days Meet Dakar Jeep Tour
Event Description: Our Dakar adventure is not limited to those able to ride a bike! Calling it the Spectator Only Tour, we'll take you in a jeep to the best spots to watch the rally, stopping at key locations along the route. A complete off-road adventure with overnight stays in desert camps. You have the choice to drive the jeep alone, following the guide's jeep, or let an experienced driver take on the challenge of tackling the off-road sections. Definitely a once in a lifetime adventure with the comfort and safety of a luxury jeep like Toyota Landcruiser or similar.

Title: Swiss Orchestra
Event Description: Rooted in the rich musical landscape of Switzerland, the Swiss Orchestra is made up of some of the country's most talented and accomplished musicians. Together with classical favourites and revived Swiss works, this ensemble also delivers captivating performances that can transcend genres. Donâ€™t miss out on what is sure to be a stirring night of orchestral excellence.

Title: Abdulaziz Manaa Concert
Event Description: Sing the night away at Souq Alwaleen with Abdulaziz Manaa.

Title: House Of Hype
Event Description: The House of Hype immersive experience is a universe of beautiful and odd worlds filled with places to explore, play games, become a star, discover surprises, shop exclusive products, and win prizes. Inspired by video games, fashion, music, and social media trends, House of Hype is a mind bending whirl of experiences you will never forget.

Title: Cyan Waterpark
Event Description: Biggest Waterpark in Saudi Arabia, Suitable for all ages.

Title: Lucky Cat
Event Description: Lucky Cat by Kimono is a fusion of Japanese cuisine with a fresh perspective, featuring a wide range of rolls, buns, noodles, sandos, and katsu flavors that will transport you to the streets of Japan!

Title: MAGANDA
Event Description: Welcome to MAGANDA, where tradition meets the modern in a symphony of bold and exotic tastes. Step into a realm where the streets of Manila come alive with an urban, hip twist. Our Filipino restaurant redefines street food, offering a rare, authentic experience that pushes culinary boundaries.

Title: Bienalsur at Samoca
Event Description: BIENALSUR is a multipolar contemporary art biennial working as a network of associative collaboration between museums, cultural centers, and universities around the globe, stemming from the South of the South as an exercise of indiscipline. Because it develops a horizontal network, BIENALSUR links artists, curators, and diverse social groups of different origins and trajectories on an equal footing; thus, building new circuits of exchange that only take place within the framework of this project.

Title: Toriigate
Event Description: Our restaurant features a fusion of traditional Japanese flavors and modern culinary trends, expertly crafted by our skilled chefs using only the freshest and highest-quality ingredients. From savory grilled meats and seafood to aromatic soups and stews, our menu reflects Japan's rich and varied cuisine. Our mission at Toriigate is to provide an authentic and immersive dining experience that showcases the rich and diverse flavors of Japanese cuisine. We are dedicated to using the highest quality ingredients and traditional grilling techniques to create delicious and memorable dishes that pay homage to the culinary traditions of Japan. We aim to exceed our guests' expectations and make our restaurant the go-to destination for Japanese cuisine in Jeddah.

Title: Ninja Course
Event Description: Where all of your best activities are under one roof Trampoline, Soft play area, Ninja Course, VR, Arcade games, Carnaval games, delicious snacks and Beverages, and much more.

Title: Bulan
Event Description: Our concept at Bulan by Jawico is straightforward. We offer the freshest, highest quality Javanese dishes prepared right in front of you. Bulan, by Jawico, specializes in authentic Javanese cuisine that will tantalize your taste buds, featuring dishes that start with white rice and include delicious options like baby veal, chicken, and vegetables. We aim to provide healthy dishes with balanced nutritional values. This commitment means we hand-slice only the freshest tomatoes, potatoes, and onions every morning to accompany our succulent meat and chicken dishes. Our dedication to quality and freshness defines the values and standards of Bulan by Jawico.

Title: Bali Lounge
Event Description: Bali Lounge is a Little Asia exclusive lounge serving shisha and fresh juices on the fountain view.

Title: Fakieh Aquarium
Event Description: A captivating underwater world filled with vibrant coral reefs, graceful stingrays, and a lot more sea wonders. Explore interactive exhibits, learn about marine life, and create lasting memories in this mesmerizing aquatic paradise with your family. 10 AM - 11 PM Sat - Thu 12 PM - 11 PM Fri.

Title: Meet the Start of the Dakar Rally
Event Description: The start of the Dakar Rally will take place with the srutineering on January 4, the prologue on January 5 and the start of stage 1 on January 6 in the beautiful region of Al-Ula. The Dakar goes over 15 days with 13 race days in 12 stages and 1 rest day and will end on January 19. On this short trip you will see the Dakar paddock, the prologue and the start of the Dakar as well as the beautiful region round Al-Ula on a Jeep Adventure Tour. Dating back to biblical times, Al-Ula, with its 1000-year-old rock formations, is an enchanting open-air museum and a perfect setting for a short trip round the Dakar's start camp. Al-Ula is ideal to get a taste of Dakar air and meet the racers in the start camp, to watch the prologue and the start of the first stage on spectator points and in the city you can feel the growing race fever.

Title: Meet the Finish of the Dakar Rally
Event Description: The finish of the Dakar Rally will take place with the last stages from Al-Ula reaching the final in Yanbu on January 19. After 14 days of racing the Dakar will see its winners. On this 5-day short trip you will see the Dakar paddock and the last stages during 3 offroad days with 2 overnight camps in the desert on a Jeep Adventure Tour. Join the price giving ceremony on the evening of January 19 live. Dating back to biblical times, Al-Ula, with its 1000-year-old rock formations, is an enchanting open-air museum and a perfect setting up for the start of this tour. Meeting the racers on your arrival day we will head south to Yanbu where we will meet the rally at spectator points and for the final in Yanbu. On this 5-day trip you will get a maximum Dakar experience and will see the beautiful landscape of the Al-Ula to Yanbu region which is home to the Red Sea Project, Saudi Arabians most ambitious tourism project.

Title: Meet the Dakar Rally in the Empty Quarter
Event Description: The Dakar Rally begins its long stages into the Empty Quarter on January 9th. Almost 3,000 km over 4 days of racing through the sea of dunes in southern Saudi Arabia is perhaps the toughest challenge of the entire rally. The Dakar goes over 15 days with 13 race days in 12 stages and 1 rest day and will end on January 19. On this short trip you will see the Dakar stage 3 and 4 and the bivouac in Al Salamiya at the entrance of the Empty Quarter on a Jeep Adventure Tour. The terrain in the Empty Quarter is covered with sand dunes up to 250 meters (820 ft) high interspersed with gravel. The sand is reddish-orange and gives this area a very special and enchanting atmosphere. As we are limited by time and distance on our tour, this short trip will catch up with the Dakar Rally during its bivouac in Al Salamiya on the first and second day and then take us into the sea of dunes in the Empty Quarter over three days as far as we can go with our fuel reserves.

Title: RS Tennis Cup (Females)
Event Description: Riyadh welcomes the best female tennis players in the world to compete for the Riyadh Tennis Season Cup, an exciting sports tournament that reflects the excellence of the players and the beauty of the game.

Title: RS Tennis Cup (Males)
Event Description: Riyadh welcomes the best male tennis players in the world to compete for the Riyadh Tennis Season Cup, an exciting sports tournament that reflects the excellence of the players and the beauty of the game.

Title: Day of Reckoning
Event Description: An exciting night of world-class boxing at Day of Reckoning! Eight intense matchups, each delivering heart-pounding action, will unfold LIVE at Kingdom Arena. Don't miss a single moment of this adrenaline-packed event!

Title: Workshop Arabic Calligraphy And Typography
Event Description: Workshop presenter: Yousef Hafez Qari Employing and demonstrating the flexibility of Arabic calligraphy loaded on devices to create innovative artistic forms.

Title: Workshop Arabic Calligraphy With Light
Event Description: Workshop presenter: Shaker Samarkandi How to write Arabic calligraphy using light with slow exposure.

Title: Workshop : Arabic calligraphy in jewelry
Event Description: Workshop presenter : Adnan Safi Allah. Employing Arabic calligraphy in jewelry.

Title: The Endless Loop
Event Description: The story takes place inside a landfill. Despite the difficulty of life in the city, the characters manage to adapt to the interesting and bizarre place. Each character is stuck in a cycle of trying to become the most prominent member of the community and continuously failing to do so. The cycle repeats until they realize that the real obstacle is their resistance to change.

Title: The Devilâ€™s Memory
Event Description: A depressed girlâ€™s suicide attempt turns into a debate about life and the philosophy of how a homeless person prevented her suicide. This play discusses the trauma of domestic violence and its effects on people.

Title: Riyadh Theater Festival
Event Description: The opening ceremony is a harmony of wonderful creative elements that take the audience on a magical journey with a creative show and a short film about the honoree to celebrate the world of theater and its prosperity in the Kingdom. The ceremony will conclude with a play honoring the late artist Mohamad Al-Othaim, the play is Souq Qubbat Rasheed, to be a highlight of the festivalâ€™s creativity. About â€˜Souq Qubbat Rasheedâ€™ Play: The play tells a hypothetical story of cousins who live in an old neighborhood next to the historic Qubbat Rasheed market in the city of Buraidah. An ongoing debate takes place between them between those who support the demolition of the neighborhood and the market and rebuilding it after each of them takes their shares, and between those who oppose that under the pretext of preserving the past and opposing any change, and both groups take an exaggerated position towards the other, without any compromise solutions. The conflict takes them time and effort, which threatens them to lose their futureâ€¦ the future of the following generations.

Title: World of Dates
Event Description: The Global Cooking and Tasting Zone, showcasing 6 international kitchens, provides a distinctive and delightful opportunity to savor international date-based dishes. A dedicated space designed to educate and train visitors in date-based cooking, in collaboration with top local and international chefs. Exclusive sections are allocated to date exhibitors from diverse regions of the Kingdom, offering a distinct shopping experience to purchase dates from various areas. The Museum area explores the culture and heritage of the Kingdom, intertwined with palm trees and dates, providing an engaging journey through the history of the palm tree in the Arabian Peninsula and the Kingdom. Food Industries Zone showcases the finest array of fresh date-based bakery products, straight from the oven. Daily raffles and diverse prizes (Over 60 iPhone Pro Max and a car!) for all visitors.

Title: The Slap

Journey Through Time | Visit Saudi ArabiaContact UsStart ChatLocal Call Center 930-International Call Center:click hereEnglishSee & DoPlan Your TripTravel EssentialsSaudi CalendarExperiencesSaudi MapApply for eVisaMadinahExperiencesAdventures & ExperiencesJourney Through TimeJourney Through TimeAlulaOrganized ByHusaak AdventuresOverviewEmbark on a journey through time on this 3 km historical treasure site adorned with clusters of pictographs that have stood for two thousand years. This trail is not only a testament to AlUla's rich heritage but also a showcase of its breathtaking natural beauty.

As you embark on the Journey Through Time trail, you will be transported into the past, walking in the footsteps of those who came before. The pictographs, dating back millennia, offer glimpses into the lives, stories, and culture of those who once roamed these lands. The trail itself is a journey of around 3 to 4 hours, depending on your fitness levels, and covers various carvings, each telling its own unique tale. 



To reach this historical marvel, you'll embark on a 1 hour 10-minute drive each way. In winter months, the trail presents an added element of adventure, as some sections may be adorned with deep pools of rainwater. But fear not, for these pools are a natural part of the journey. Pack a change of clothes to fully embrace this element and let the water pools become a part of your story.

This is a chance to witness the enduring power of nature's artistry and to explore its rich history that has been etched into the stones and sands. So, gather your adventurous spirit and step onto the trail, where history, nature, and the human journey intertwine.

Umm Al-Hadid, also known as "Baydaâ€™ Allahy," is a sulfur well surrounded by palm trees, plants, and grass.



Baydaâ€™ Allahy is one of the most famous areas in the Empty Quarter, serving as a crossroads to the east, leading to AlQaad area, and to the west, reaching Um Quroon and Tawil Al-Khatam.

Starting from the northwestern part (Haradh) and passing through Umm Al-Hadid, all the way to the Heart of Baida Lahi in the southeastern part of the Empty Quarter you'll explore a variety of terrains in the region, including wells, oases, and sand dunes.

This journey spans seven days in the largest sandy desert in the world. Crossing the Empty Quarter is a once-in-a-lifetime experience that you will talk about for the rest of your life, and it will add your name to the list of the few who have crossed this beautiful area. 



The nights in the Empty Quarter are unlike any other place, you'll witness a sky filled with stars like never seen before and enjoy star gazing. The moonlit nights have their own enchanting charm as well.ItineraryDay 1- 04:30: Our journey will take off from Riyadh at an early hour, where you will witness the fabulous sunrise and feel positive energy filling your heart.
